title: Jason Cummings joins Rangers on loan from Nottingham Forest
description: Nottingham Forest forward Jason Cummings has joined Rangers on loan until the end of the season, with the Glasgow side having the option of making the deal permanent.
content:
The 22-year-old joined Forest in June from Hibernian and scored four goals in 18 appearances for the City Ground side.
Sky Sports News understands the deal Forest agreed for Cummings was in excess of £1m, and he signed a three-year deal upon joining the club.
The Edinburgh-born player came through the youth system at Hibernian before moving south.
He was part of the Hibernian side that beat Rangers in the 2016 Scottish Cup final, and scored an impressive eight goals against Rangers during his time in Scotland.
Cummings has been capped once by Scotland, with his debut coming in the 1-0 defeat to the Netherlands in November.
